user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of digest_update:
```c
_MHD_static_inline void
digest_update (struct DigestAlgorithm *da,
               const void *data,
               size_t length)
{
  mhd_assert (! da->uninitialised);
  mhd_assert (da->algo_selected);
  mhd_assert (da->ready_for_hashing);
#ifdef MHD_MD5_SUPPORT
  if (MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_MD5 == da->algo)
    MHD_MD5_update (&da->ctx.md5_ctx, (const uint8_t *) data, length);
  else
#endif /* MHD_MD5_SUPPORT */
#ifdef MHD_SHA256_SUPPORT
  if (MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_SHA256 == da->algo)
    MHD_SHA256_update (&da->ctx.sha256_ctx, (const uint8_t *) data, length);
  else
#endif /* MHD_SHA256_SUPPORT */
#ifdef MHD_SHA512_256_SUPPORT
  if (MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_SHA512_256 == da->algo)
    MHD_SHA512_256_update (&da->ctx.sha512_256_ctx,
                           (const uint8_t *) data, length);
  else
#endif /* MHD_SHA512_256_SUPPORT */
  mhd_assert (0);   /* May not happen */
#ifdef _DEBUG
  da->hashing = true;
#endif
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
mhd_assert (0);   /* May not happen */
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: Not inherently violated. In the shown code mhd_assert(0) is the final else of a chain of runtime conditionals (enabled/disabled by feature macros) and can be reached at runtime if da->algo has a value that is not handled by the enabled MHD_*_SUPPORT branches. Therefore the statement is not necessarily unreachable. However, Rule 2.1 would be violated if, by construction, the final else can never be taken — for example, if da->algo is an enum whose possible values are exactly the algorithms covered by the enabled support macros (e.g. enum { MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_MD5, MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_SHA256 } and both MHD_MD5_SUPPORT and MHD_SHA256_SUPPORT are defined). In that case the mhd_assert(0) branch is provably unreachable and would violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1.
